name: Hollywood Visionary
description: Make the movie of your dreams amid the glamor and romance of 1950s Hollywood! Hire Alfred Hitchcock, seduce Greta Garbo, or build your studio into a powerhouse.

reviews.review_text: Named myself Leonardo DiCaprio and won an Oscar. 0/10 for realism.  No but seriously get this game if you like a good story and don't mind reading a bit (well more like a lot) of text.   Edit: Since Leo won an Oscar now, this review doesn't work anymore. Goddammit.

I like the game, but there's a glitch with the name-formatting of the grip, for one - I can insert any last name I want, but it'll still inevitably say 'there's already a character with this last name' unless I pick a pre-determined one.  This bug has been around since launch (I originally got it on another platform), and I'm surprised it hasn't been fixed yet.
Got me hooked and i loved every minute of it.
Loving this game, it is so easy to immerse yourself in  10/10

Only played 25 minutes so far, I realized this was the best game in my library when I read this.     'So we've got a contemplative, middlebrow, occasionally risky horror drama as the first release from ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥S.'

A little shorter than I would have liked but really good overall.   Only major complaint was being constantly asked what my pronouns were near the start. I find it a bit silly that I can have my family and friends refer to me as female, but my film crew refer to me as male.

I have been playing this game non-stop on my work's computer. I really love it a lot! I know text-based games aren't for everyone but if you like great stories in text-based games, you will love this. Being interested in filmmaking (Not to sound like a ♥♥♥♥♥♥) also makes me love this game too. Overall, I strongly suggest it. It's brilliantly written and has a very high replay value. Also the Steam Achievements are great, as they make you play over and over, doing scenarios differently to obtain certain achievements. Some of the choices are actually pretty hard to decide, to the point where I kinda get worried if I made the wrong decision... But I digress. It's awesome!!!!
